messages.content:
I'm trying to check if a transaction is successfully accepted to the blockchain by using its hash.

I dived into the source code of Auro Wallet, o1js, and looked at old snarkyjs commits for the required GraphQL API usage, but finally I noticed that there is a builtin function called `checkZkappTransaction`.
It seemed like it was doing the job I needed.

However I wasn't able to find a way to make it work.

```ts
Mina.setActiveInstance(Mina.Network('https://proxy.berkeley.minaexplorer.com'))

const status = await checkZkappTransaction('5Jv5UuuvNwn1BNnvmdF43uQFUBzXC6dWMGL7TP47xLrEMMnry7e5',)

console.log(status) // always prints {success: false, failureReason: null}
```
Example Successful Transaction: <https://berkeley.minaexplorer.com/transaction/5Jv5UuuvNwn1BNnvmdF43uQFUBzXC6dWMGL7TP47xLrEMMnry7e5>

I expect it to return `{success: true}` but it somehow doesn't.
Can you try it with fresh transaction just included into block?
OK. I sent a tx now.
I'll test it again
<https://berkeley.minaexplorer.com/transaction/5JuHPapdb8J7u1WssYHyPBxgKLTGbBidSyhD5Pr2e4ffAS6eeovp>
I tested this transaction
It still returns the same mistaken value.
Oh, thanks for testing.

However I ran it again and it still returns the same.
```sh
  console.log
    { success: false, failureReason: null }
```
It seems like non-deterministic. 😭
Maybe I can assume that it is a successful transaction by saying that `failureReason` is `null`?
Because both my and your result says that there is no `failureReason`.

It gives true only for a few minutes after inclusion to the block:
```
[9:11:41 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:12:42 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:13:42 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:14:42 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:15:42 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:16:43 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:17:43 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:18:43 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:19:44 AM]  [ { success: true, failureReason: null } ]
[9:20:44 AM]  [ { success: true, failureReason: null } ]
[9:21:44 AM]  [ { success: true, failureReason: null } ]
[9:22:44 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:23:44 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
[9:24:45 AM]  [ { success: false, failureReason: null } ]
```
No, see above

Why do you need it?

An alternative solution would be to check the state:
1) Use hasAccount() in case it is the first transaction and the account is being created
2) Check the nonce of the feePayer
3) Check zkApp state: zkApp.value.get()

You should be very fast to catch "true" result 🤣 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zRKEzZMPosQ

messages.content:
I'd like to run some code when any interactions with my contract are made.
I'd like to keep track of a merkle tree in a backend server.
Each client will notify the backend server after they submit a transaction.
So I will update the merkle tree accordingly.
However I don't have a way to verify that if a specific tx is successful.
Use events
Hmm, I also thought about it, is it real time?
Or do I have to check them periodically?
Thank you so much for helping me.
Sometimes getting help from another brain is really necessary. I see I've overcomplicated things.
